quotes.quote: Do not forget to entertain strangers, for by so doing some people have entertained angels without knowing it.
When angels visit us, we do not hear the rustle of wings, nor feel the feathery touch of the breast of a dove; but we know their presence by the love they create in our hearts.
Are not all angels ministering spirits sent to serve those who will inherit salvation?
The reason angels can fly is because they take themselves lightly.
God not only sends special angels into our lives, but sometimes He even sends them back again if we forget to take notes the first time!
Make yourself familiar with the angels and behold them frequently in spirit; for without being seen, they are present with you.
Angels are sent to bring us messages from God's heart.
The soul at its highest is found like God, but an angel gives a closer idea of him. That is all an angel is: an idea of God.
Angels are all around us, all the time, in the very air we breathe.
Angels are inseparable friends, who bring strength and consolation to those who include them in their lives. In truth, Angels are our best friends.
Angels are intelligent reflections of light, that original light which has no beginning. They can illuminate. They do not need tongues or ears, for they can communicate without speech, in thought.
Angels have no philosophy but love.
Angels encourage us by guiding us onto a path that will lead to happiness and hope.
Angels represent God's personal care for each one of us.
O passing angel, speed me with a song, a melody of heaven to reach my heart and rouse me to the race and make me strong.
All God's angels come to us disguised.
Angels are messengers, but sometimes we misunderstand their language.
Angels shine from without because their spirits are lit from within by the light of God.
An angel can illuminate the thought and mind of man by strengthening the power of vision, and by bringing within his reach some truth which the angel himself contemplates.
The Lord will command his angels to take good care of you. They will lift you up in their hands. Then you won't trip over a stone.
It is not because angels are holier than men or devils that makes them angels, but because they do not expect holiness from one another, but from God alone.
Angels descending, bring from above, echoes of mercy, whispers of love.
Pride ruined the angels.
All God's angels come to us disguised.
The gaurdian angels of life sometimes fly so high as to be beyond our sight, but they are always looking down upon us.
Angels represent God's personal care for each one of us.
An angel is a spiritual creature created by God for the service of Christendom and the church.

The angels are the dispensers and administrators of the divine beneficence toward us; they regard our safety, undertake our defense, direct our ways, and exercise a constant solicitude that no evil befall us.
Music is well said to be the speech of angels.
But if these beings guard you, they do so because they have been summoned by your prayers.
Angels are visible to those who accept the light and break the pact made with darkness.
We are each of us angels with only one wing, and we can only fly by embracing one another.
Angels appear in many different forms to hold your hand through the difficult times.
It was pride that changed angels into devils; it is humility that makes men as angels.
The guardian angels of life sometimes fly so high as to be beyond our sight, but they are always looking down upon us.
If instead of a gem, or even a flower, we should cast the gift of a loving thought into the heart of a friend, that would be giving as the angels give.
Every visible thing in this world is put in the charge of an angel.
Gratitude is our most direct line to God and the angels.
I saw the angel in the marble and carved until I set him free.
The air up there in the clouds is very pure and fine, bracing and delicious. And why shouldn't it be? It is the same the angels breathe.
You're in the arms of the Angels. May you find some comfort here.

Angels are spirits, but it is not because they are spirits that they are angels. They become angels when they are sent. For the name angel refers to their office, not their nature. You ask the name of this nature, it is spirit, you ask its office, it is that of an Angel, which is a messenger.
Everything that we see is a shadow cast by that which we do not see.
Beside each believer stands an Angel as protector and shepherd, leading him to life.
The angels stand between us and God, but they are translucent, even transparent, and they beckon us to penetrate their luminosity.
Outside the open window The morning air is all awash with angels.
Angels transcend every religion, every philosophy, every creed. In fact Angels have no religion as we know it. Their existence precedes every religious system that has ever existed on Earth.
If men were angels, no government would be necessary.
Everything we call a trial, a sorrow, or a duty, believe me, that angel's hand is there.
An angel is a spiritual creature created by God without a body, for the service of Christendom and of the church.
All forces that reside in the body are angels.
Better the devil you know than the angel you don't.
In heaven an angel is nobody in particular.
Trust no friend without faults, and love a woman, but no angel.

The angels as the guardians of men are set over men as instructors and monitors. This shows the relationship that is to exist between them. Man's attitude is to be one of obedience and subjection. He is to follow the lead of the angels, and consequently some reverence is already implied in the very relationship that exists between man and angel.
Death makes angels of us all and gives us wings where we had shoulders smooth as raven's claws.
While mortals sleep, the angels keep their watch of wondering love.
Angels can fly because they take themselves lightly.
God always has an angel of help for those who are willing to do their duty.
